events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and filed a claim to begin the reimbursement process.
The claim was reviewed and categorised as an Auto Accident based on the description and keywords in the initial report.
An experienced agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim to ensure timely processing and customer support.
The claim notification was formally acknowledged and the customer was informed about the next steps in the resolution.
To proceed with the investigation, the customer was asked to submit accident photos, police reports, and vehicle repair estimates.
The customer promptly submitted all required documents including images of the damaged car and the official police accident report.
The investigation team commenced review of all submitted evidence to verify claim validity and evaluate repair costs.
Investigation confirmed the legitimacy of the claim and verified the extent of damage on the vehicle requiring covered repairs.
The claims team proposed a settlement amount covering the repair expenses, minus the deductible, to the customer.
The customer accepted the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the prompt and clear communication.
After confirmation of customer agreement, the claim was formally approved by the claims manager for payment processing.
The payment corresponding to the approved settlement amount was issued directly to the customer's repair shop.
Following payment issuance and customer confirmation of repairs, the claim was formally closed and marked resolved.
All claim documentation and correspondence were archived securely for future reference and compliance purposes.
